title: Cheval Vapeur
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Denby
provenance_text:
Pierre Alechinsky [b. 1927], Paris, France [1]; Lefebre Gallery, New York, NY [2]; Mr. [1901-1982] and Mrs. Charles Denby (Rosamond Reed Denby) [1906-1988], Sewickley, PA, November 1961 until March 28, 1963 [3]; their gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, March 1963.

Notes:
[1]. The Belgian artist has lived and worked in France since 1951. 
[2]. This work was exhibited in "The 1961 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1961 - January 1962. It was part (no. 447) of "One-Man Exhibitions Honoring Seven Artists Represented in the 1961 Pittsburgh International." It was lent by Lefebre Gallery.
[3]. Mr. Charles Denby purchased the work from the International for $1,100. Payment was sent to Lefebre Gallery on November 24, 1961; acknowledgement of payment was made by the gallery on November 21, 1961. Mr. and Mrs. Charles Denby gifted the work to Carnegie Institute following the exhibition "Art Since 1900 - Privately Owned in the Pittsburgh Area" held at Carnegie Institute, January - February 1963.
